word:
Depression Produced by Iron Dignity.--Some preserve a cold, chilling reserve, an iron dignity, that repels those who are brought within their influence. This spirit 


                                                 483 

is contagious; it creates an atmosphere that is withering to good impulses and good resolves; it chokes the natural current of human sympathy, cordiality, and love; and under its influence people become constrained, and their social and generous attributes are destroyed for want of exercise.
